name: H6-2 - Portable Gas Cylinders
intro: This questionnaire verifies your knowledge of safe and effective operations at incidents involving portable gas cylinders and pressurized vessels as defined in NCI 33.

structure.description: FENZ Act 2017 Section 39 provides the OIC with the powers of an Enforcement Officer as defined by the Hazardous Substances and New Organisms Act 1996 when managing incidents involving portable gas cylinders.
Which steps should you take when attending an incident involving a leaking cylinder (not involved in fire)?
options: Approach and park downwind and downhill
Evacuate and cordon the affected area
Prevent ignition and monitor the flammability range if possible
Identify the gas and isolate the leak
Keep all doors and windows closed
Liaise with HSTLC or the enforcement officer
Leave the cylinder in place and do not touch it
correctAnswer: Evacuate and cordon the affected area
Prevent ignition and monitor the flammability range if possible
Identify the gas and isolate the leak
Liaise with HSTLC or the enforcement officer

structure.description: If a gas cylinder has been involved in fire, what should be done differently to the standard leaking cylinder procedure?
options: Park upwind and uphill in a SAFE location
Cool the cylinder from a safe position
Remove the cylinder to a safe and secure place
All of the above
correctAnswer: Park upwind and uphill in a SAFE location
Cool the cylinder from a safe position

structure.description: Explain the procedure to safely manage an incident involving an acetylene cylinder involved in a fire or exposed to heat.
options: If it is possible to view cylinder from behind a solid structure: Do not approach the cylinder: Evacuate the area for a 200 metre radius, leave the cylinder in position and apply copious water after the fire is extinguished, check for residual heat after 1 hour. Continue sequence until uniformly cold and remains cold for more than 1 hour. Notify gas supplier to remove; FENZ personnel are not to move it.

If NOT possible to view cylinder from behind a solid structure: Do not approach the cylinder, Evacuate the area for a 200 metre radius. Leave the cylinder in position and apply copious water after the fire is extinguished. Check for residual heat after 1 hour. Continue sequence until uniformly cold and remains cold for more than 1 hour. Notify gas supplier to remove; FENZ personnel are not to move it.
correctAnswer: If it is possible to view cylinder from behind a solid structure: Do not approach the cylinder: Evacuate the area for a 200 metre radius, leave the cylinder in position and apply copious water after the fire is extinguished, check for residual heat after 1 hour. Continue sequence until uniformly cold and remains cold for more than 1 hour. Notify gas supplier to remove; FENZ personnel are not to move it.

If NOT possible to view cylinder from behind a solid structure: Do not approach the cylinder, Evacuate the area for a 200 metre radius. Leave the cylinder in position and apply copious water after the fire is extinguished. Check for residual heat after 1 hour. Continue sequence until uniformly cold and remains cold for more than 1 hour. Notify gas supplier to remove; FENZ personnel are not to move it.

structure.description: What control measures should be put in place in case of BLEVE (Boiling Liquid Expanding Vapour Explosion)?
options: All personnel will be trained in the conditions to be encountered and the safe practices required when working at incidents involving bulk flammable gases
Preplanning and risk assessment with crews briefed on plan of action and safety measures
Use as many personnel as available
Wildfire gear must be worn at all times
Evacuate all unnecessary personnel and public from the area and establish an inner cordon
Cool cylinders from a protected position
Approach the cylinders with a protective water spray
Take care not to freeze up relief valves if cooling water is applied
correctAnswer: All personnel will be trained in the conditions to be encountered and the safe practices required when working at incidents involving bulk flammable gases
Preplanning and risk assessment with crews briefed on plan of action and safety measures
Evacuate all unnecessary personnel and public from the area and establish an inner cordon
Cool cylinders from a protected position
Take care not to freeze up relief valves if cooling water is applied

structure.description: In addition to the standard precautions, what control measures should be taken when dealing with gas clouds?
options: Use a gas detector in the centre of the cloud to check for possibility of ignition
No personnel to enter the gas cloud
Maintain awareness of the dangers of leaking pressurised gas
Use positive pressure ventilation to blow the cloud away
correctAnswer: No personnel to enter the gas cloud
Maintain awareness of the dangers of leaking pressurised gas
